channel.title: mozilla on Whitaker Lab
channel.description: Recent content in mozilla on Whitaker Lab

item.title: My experiences as a Mozilla Open Leader
item.description: Mozilla Open Leadership Earlier this year Mozilla Science Lab awarded a mini grant to me to refactor the Whitaker Lab’s openly developed project Brain Networks in Python. I also applied successfully to the recently concluded 4th Mozilla Open Leadership Training cohort. With the application deadline for the next round of both approaching I thought I should share my experiences. I wasn’t sure when I sent my application in what open leadership training meant.

item.title: Mozilla Mini Grant application 2017
item.description: This is my application for a Mozilla Mini Grant. The application was submitted on the 1st of June 2017. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License which means you can distribute, remix, tweak, and build upon these answers as long as you credit me for the original creation. Mozilla Mini Grant application 1st June 2017 Applicant Details Name: Isla Staden Physical address: Alan Turing Institute

item.title: How I became a Mozilla Fellow for Science
item.description: My Mozilla Fellowship journey I wrote a blog post for the Mozilla Science Lab to encourage everyone to apply for the 2017 Mozilla fellows for science cohort. You can check out the whole post at the Mozilla Science Lab blog but here are a couple of key links. I’ve put my applications online in the resources section of this website if you want to see what I wrote: My unsuccessful 2015 application My successful 2016 application Here’s where you can find out more information and apply!

item.title: London MicroWOW
item.description: Learning to work openly using git and GitHub On Friday 28th April the wonderful Bruno Vieira, my fellow Mozilla Fellow for Science was in London and we decided to run a micro Working Open Workshop (#microWOW!) This is in contrast to a full WOW which is a two day extravaganza and a mini WOW which is a one day event. We only had one evening but we tried to fit as much of what we knew about working open and collaborating using git and GitHub as possible.

item.title: Mozilla Fellows for Science Application 2015
item.description: On this page you can find the answers from my (unsuccessful) application to become a Mozilla Fellow for Science in 2015. The application was submitted on August 14th at 7:01pm while on holiday in Edinburgh! I had some delicious cocktails that evening üòä üç∏. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License which means you can distribute, remix, tweak, and build upon these answers as long as you credit me for the original creation.

item.title: Mozilla Fellows for Science Application 2016
item.description: On this page you can find the answers from my (successful!) application to become a Mozilla Fellow for Science in 2016. The application was submitted on Jul 15th at 11:33pm (swoosh, just before the deadline).
